Funny, different, genuinely enjoyable. One of the most perfect games I've ever played. Some of the puzzles will have you scream until you suddenly realise how it's done and yell "YES!" as you sail through the air to your goal. Amazing game, will hold a fond place in my heart forever :)
This games rocks. If you have a doubt, at least try it out! One of my fav games of all times.
Really fun game :) I recommend it to Everyone!
A crowning achievement in video games, the original Portal is one of the most well-designed and thought out games I've ever played.

This game impressed me by how motivating it is. I easily get frustrated with puzzles these days, but the way the challenges are designed, you just know that it's not really a task of managing intellectual complexity, but you just have to look through the illusion of complexity and see the simple solution. It's fun to analyze a problem step-by-step, often in reverse order, with the confidence that eventually you'll overcome it.
When trying to complete Antichamber, I was tempted to use guides for solving one or two of the problems, but not in Portal. In Portal, when I spent too much time on a puzzle, I just gave it a rest and continued the next day.
So this is a very good game for cultivating mental resolve without overburdening you. I wouldn't want to miss my play time of Portal.
Muy buen juego

Portal forma parte de ese pequeño y a la vez gran grupo de los Juegazos que pasarán a la historia. Uno de los mejores juegos de Puzzle, y además del gran Valve. El único punto negativo es su corta duración, pero no será problema si te acaba gustando, porque lo más probable es que te compres la secuela.
En definitiva, uno de esos juegos que debes tener sí o sí.

Despite living in the shadow of it's sequel I still say Portal is the superior game. Maybe its the fact that it was one the first actual puzzle games I got into, but the sense of no escape was just not present enough in Portal 2.

This game is a great game, the second one is better but i'm talking about this one. In this game you play as a girl named Chell, and you use a thing called a quantnam space hole genorator or something like that aka the "portal gun". In the game you have to deafeat the homosidal robot: GLaDoS (yes, you have to capidalize those letters). GLaDoS will place you in rooms with the portal gun and in those rooms will be filled with the folowing items: buttons, cubes, lasers, acids, doors and diffrent colered walls. White walls you can shoot portals onto and black walls you cannot. The rooms you will be put into are called test chambers. They are each filled with different puzzels and they get harder as you progress. Also just to note there are things that shoot you: Turrets, and anamate objects that are freindly: Companion cubes.

The game isn't perrfect so I give it an 8.5 out of 10

Voy a ser sincero, siempre pense que este juego era horrible, pesado y aburrido, por eso me mantuve alejado sin almenos probarlo unos minutos por mucho tiempo. Hasta que un amigo me lo regalo en steam y con pocas ganas pense, ya que es un regalo aver que tal es...puedo decir que cambio totalmente mi pensamiento sobre portal, rapidamente me enganche y me parecio un juego genial, muy ingenioso, divertido con buenos dialogos y con un muy buen sentido del humor. La historia me encanto, la idea de los portales y como encaja todo esta muy buena, el motor grafico de valve apesar de sus años siempre te deja un buen sabor, a lo largo de la historia este juego seguro que te va a sacar mas de una sonrisa, el unico punto "malo" por asi decir que encontre es que me resulto un poquito corto pero lo bueno es que se rejuega facilmente, lo recomiendo totalmente!

Portal is a puzzle game. Its almost as simple as that, and thankfuly that all portal needs to do to get your attention. What this game is using a portals fired from a gun to get around obstacles. The plot of the game is that you are Chell and you are chosen by a computer named GLaDOS to full-fill a test, and if you finish that test then you will receive cake. The gameplay was the most inovative at the time and it still stacks up to the demands of today, although this game has one small weakness, the game is only 2-4 hours. With that in mind, this game can be what you expect it to be but, its twist comes from what the game does with its small amount of time and simple premise that is created.

Portal. C'è poco da dire, questo gioco è probabilmente per buona parte (ma non del tutto come dicono alcuni) solo un esercizio di stile, ma lo fa molto bene. Non date retta a chi dice che duri 5 ore o che non abbia trama - la trama c'è eccome, basta rendersene conto. In generale se non si bada solo a sparare portali a destra e a manca ci si gode meglio il gioco (ed ecco che invece di 5 ne dura 10). Portal è un conglomerato di piccoli dettagli, che possono sfuggire ad una prima partita. Consigliata la modalità commento. Dalle illuminazioni alle musiche passando dai monologhi deliranti dell'unico altro personaggio attivo del gioco oltre la protagonista, senza dimenticare quanti forse sono passati prima di noi tra le stanze asettiche della Aperture, Portal è un gioco coinvolgente su tanti livelli. Portal 2 sarà ancora "peggio", da questo punto di vista...

If your looking for a puzzle game or just quick fun, this is your game.

Highly addicting. Although its very short theres still the advanced chambers and challange maps that truly bump the difficulty up to do. Sure its only about two hours of the main game to do. You can always replay it and do extra chambers that make thinking in portals fun. So now that I did this review wheres my cake?

Portal is a short first person 3D puzzle game that was designed to be in the Orange Box, along with Half Life 2, Half Life 2 Episodes One and Two, and Team Fortress 2. In the game, you play as Chell, a silent protagonist who navigates her way through Apeture Laboratories, a testing faucility for the Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device (ASHPD), or Portal Gun.

     The Portal Gun shoots two portals: an orange and blue one. If you go through one, you come out the other. You use these portals to solve puzzles, or test chambers. You are commentated on by GLADoS, a seemingly friendly A.I. You are promised cake and grief counseling at the end of the chambers by GLADoS, but as you make your way through the lonely test chambers,  you start to suspect that not only is there something wrong with GLADoS, but with Aperture Laboratories itself.

     The game itself is brilliant, with difficult puzzles and intriguing plot, this game is all around wonderfull. My only complaint is that the game is too short. On your first playthrough, it will take you 2 hours max to complete the game. And that's being too generous. I understand that they had to make it short because the main game in the Orange Box was Half Life 2, but they could have added more puzzles. 

      Another interesting feature of the game if you're into video game backstory is the fact that this game fits into the Half Life universe. So if you like finding all the cute little easter eggs that connect the games together, go for it. However, Portal 2 has more crossovers to Half Life. 

     This is one of my favorite games of all time, and I will give this game a 9/10 for the shortness. If you haven't played Portal,  fork out the extra ten dollars, enjoy this exellent game, and remember that the cake is a lie.

"Simple" logic game with a lot of personality. I heard a lot about this game before finally deciding to purchase it (mostly I heard the very catchy song from the end credits that went viral a while ago), and I haven't regretted it. There is a story going on the background, but most of the game's focus is on the gameplay, which consists of several simple elements that have been put together to make progressively challenging puzzles. Many of these puzzles can be solved in multiple ways, and the challenges that are unlocked after beating the game, as well as the achievements, really add to its re-playability.
